Description: Body and base sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; glaze fired red-brown; exterior, from top: two friezes of dotes between lines; black-figure decoration consisting of row of hoplites (parts of five remaining) marching to right with round shields (incised rims with added red in centre; hailstone filling ornament); five bands; frieze of narrow tongues; four bands around a central depression on the base; .
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Gauckler, P., Nécropoles Puniques de Carthage I-II. Paris 1915, pl. CLXIX. Note the hailstone dots on the Carthage vessel are larger than on British Museum 1886,1201.1298. See also the British Museum aryballos 1867,0508.885, from Nola.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 61-2, no. A34)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.135) (Phase 1)
